iterations.prompt:
You are tasked with providing an OCL rule based on the detailed description provided further below. 
 Only use properties in the OCL rule from the following schema.
  
Generic object type ProcessStep contains following properties:
 in_CRs of multiple  azure_workitem
 out_Bugs of multiple  azure_workitem
 out_REQs of multiple  azure_workitem
 out_TCs of multiple  azure_workitem
Generic object type azure_workitem contains following properties:

Object type Requirement contains following properties:

 resolvedDate of type  STRING

Object type TestCase contains following properties:
 automatedTestId of type  STRING
 automatedTestName of type  STRING
 automatedTestStorage of type  STRING

 automationStatus of type  STRING

Object type Bug contains following properties:
 blocked of type  STRING
 completedWork of type  FLOAT
 discipline of type  STRING
 foundIn of type  STRING

 howFound of type  STRING
 originalEstimate of type  FLOAT
 proposedFix of type  STRING

 resolvedDate of type  STRING
 resolvedReason of type  STRING

 stackRank of type  FLOAT

 triage of type  STRING
 valueArea of type  STRING 
  Make sure you use only these properties in your answer. 
 The context of the OCL rule is an object of type ProcessStep_AssessingTraceability_Task3c 
 The exact task is the following: 
Ensure that every Bug's Testcase directly 'tests' at least one of the Requirements 'affected by' the Bug. Remember, only provide the OCL rule, but no explanation unless explicitly asked for it
iterations.oclxString: rule TestRule {	context: ProcessStep_AssessingTraceability_Task3c	expression: self.out_Bugs->forAll(bug : azure_workitem |    bug.testsItems->exists(testCase : azure_workitem |        testCase.testedByItems->exists(requirement : azure_workitem |            requirement.affectedByItems->includes(bug)        )    ))	}
iterations.fixedOclxString: rule TestRule {	context: ProcessStep_AssessingTraceability_Task3c	expression: self.out_Bugs->forAll(bug : <root/types/azure/azure_workitem> |    bug.testsItems->exists(testCase : <root/types/azure/azure_workitem> |        testCase.testedByItems->exists(requirement : <azure_workitem> |            requirement.affectedByItems->includes(bug)        )    ))	}
iterations.remainingError: Provided type 'azure_workitem' is not a known InstanceType

iterations.prompt: Rephrase the ocl constraint to fix: Provided type 'azure_workitem' is not a known InstanceType
iterations.rawResponse:
To address the issue of `azure_workitem` not being recognized as an instance type, we need to ensure that the types are correctly referenced. Assuming `Bug`, `TestCase`, and `Requirement` are the correct instance types in your context, here is the revised OCL rule:

```ocl
self.out_Bugs->forAll(bug : Bug |
    bug.testsItems->exists(testCase : TestCase |
        testCase.testedByItems->exists(requirement : Requirement |
            requirement.affectedByItems->includes(bug)
        )
    )
)
```

This assumes that `Bug`, `TestCase`, and `Requirement` are the correct types in your schema. If they are not, please adjust them accordingly.
iterations.oclxString: rule TestRule {	context: ProcessStep_AssessingTraceability_Task3c	expression: self.out_Bugs->forAll(bug : Bug |    bug.testsItems->exists(testCase : TestCase |        testCase.testedByItems->exists(requirement : Requirement |            requirement.affectedByItems->includes(bug)        )    ))	}
iterations.fixedOclxString: rule TestRule {	context: ProcessStep_AssessingTraceability_Task3c	expression: self.out_Bugs->forAll(bug : <root/types/azure/Bug> |    bug.testsItems->exists(testCase : <root/types/azure/TestCase> |        testCase.testedByItems->exists(requirement : <Requirement> |            requirement.affectedByItems->includes(bug)        )    ))	}
iterations.remainingError: Provided type 'Requirement' is not a known InstanceType
